definition: Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
old variant of 炯[jiong3]
bright/clear
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Furthermore, CHEN Jong-ming never agree with the ideology of C. C. P. in his thought.
sentences.chinese: 而且，在思想上，陈炯明也从未认同中共的理念。

sentences.english: Sun Yat-sen and Chen Jiongming soon split over the continuation of the Northern Expedition.
sentences.chinese: 孙逸仙和陈炯明不久就因继续北伐的事宜而分道扬镳。

definition: Lu Rongting (1858-1928), provincial governor of Guangxi under the Qing, subsequently leader of old Guangxi warlord faction
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
the Northern Expeditionary Army
Bai Chongxi (1893-1966), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction, top Nationalist general, played important role in Chiang Kaishek's campaigns 1926-1949
Guangxi warlord faction, from 1911-1930
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Li Zongren (1891-1969), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction
Sun Chuanfang (1885-1935) one of the northern warlord, murdered in Tianjin in 1935
He Yingqin (1890-1987), senior Guomindang general
opposing Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 in War of national protection 1915-1916/same as 反袁鬥爭|反袁斗争
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
north China army, a modernizing Western-style army set up during late Qing, and a breeding ground for the Northern Warlords after the Qinghai revolution
National protection war or Campaign to defend the republic (1915), a rebellion against the installation of Yuan Shikai as emperor
Cai E (1882-1916), originator of the National protection army of 1915
Song Jiaoren (1882-1913), politician of the revolutionary party involved in the 1911 Xinhai revolution, murdered in Shanghai in 1913
